info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 9:52AM EDT until September 13 at 10:45AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHERN LITCHFIELD COUNTY... At 952 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Hartford. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring near Washington and New Milford. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Milford, Thomaston, Litchfield, Woodbury Center, New Preston, Oakville, Northwest Harwinton, Terryville, Gaylordsville, Watertown, Plymouth, Woodbury, Harwinton, Bethlehem, Washington, Morris, Roxbury, Bridgewater, Bantam and Gulls Hollow. The heaviest rain has ended in Litchfield County but some areas may continue to see flooding as the water recedes. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
